content.question: The graph of a function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> with <math alttext="f of b greater than f of a," overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown above for <math alttext="a, less than or equal to x, less than or equal to b" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The derivative of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>exists for all <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the interval <math alttext="a, is less than x, is less than b" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> except <math alttext="x equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. For how many values of <math alttext="c" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for <math alttext="a, less than c, less than b" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo><</mo><mi>c</mi><mo><</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, does <math alttext="the limit as x approaches c, of, the fraction with numerator f of x, minus f of c, and denominator x minus c, end fraction, equals, the fraction with numerator f of b, minus f of a, and denominator b minus a, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>a</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 2.3: Estimating Derivatives of a Function at a Point

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
